@graph.name: Collection
@graph.rdfs:comment: A Collection is a group of resources. Collections have descriptive metadata, access metadata, and may links to works and/or collections. By default, member works and collections are an
@graph.rdfs:label: Collection

@graph.name: Object
@graph.rdfs:comment: An Object is an intellectual entity, sometimes called a "work", "digital object", etc. Objects have descriptive metadata, access metadata, may contain files and other Objects as member "components". Each level of a work is therefore represented by an Object instance, and is capable of standing on its own, being linked to from Collections and other Objects. Member Objects can be ordered using the ORE Proxy class.
@graph.rdfs:label: Object

@graph.name: ComputationalWorkflow
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalWorkflow
@graph.rdfs:comment: A computational workflow consists of an orchestrated and repeatable  pattern of activity enabled by the systematic organization of resources  into processes that transform materials, provide services, or process information (source Wikipedia.org). It is executed by a computational process and is thus distinct from laboratory or business workflows.

@graph.name: FormalParameter
@graph.rdfs:label: FormalParameter
@graph.rdfs:comment: A FormalParameter is an identified variable used to stand for the actual value(s) that are consumed/produced by a set of steps

@graph.name: File
@graph.rdfs:comment:
A media object, such as an image, video, audio, or text object embedded 
in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a 
creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same
 web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may 
have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio 
stream (2 AudioObject's).
@graph.rdfs:label: File

@graph.name: Thing
@graph.rdfs:comment: The most generic type of item.
@graph.rdfs:label: Thing

@graph.name: Dataset
@graph.rdfs:comment: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.
@graph.rdfs:label: Dataset

@graph.name: fileOf
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links from a File to its containing Object.
@graph.rdfs:label: fileOf

@graph.name: hasFile
@graph.rdfs:label: hasFile
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links to a File contained by this Object.

@graph.name: hasMember
@graph.rdfs:label: hasMember
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links to a subsidiary Object or Collection. Typically used to link to component parts, such as a book linking to a page.  Note on transitivity: hasMember is   not defined as transitive, but applications may treat it as transitive as local needs   dictate.

@graph.name: memberOf
@graph.rdfs:label: memberOf
@graph.rdfs:comment: Links from an Object or Collection to a containing Object or Collection.

@graph.name: ComputationalWorkflow#input
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalWorkflow#input
@graph.rdfs:comment: An input required to use the computational workflow (eg. Excel spreadsheet, BAM file)

@graph.name: ComputationalWorkflow#output
@graph.rdfs:label: ComputationalWorkflow#output
@graph.rdfs:comment: An output produced by the computational workflow

@graph.name: RO Crate extensions to schema.org is licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0. To view a copy of this license, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0.
@graph.description: RO Crate extensions to schema.org is licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0. To view a copy of this license, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0.

@graph.name: RepositoryFile
@graph.rdfs:label: RepositoryFile
@graph.rdfs:comment: A File is a sequence of binary data and is described by some accompanying metadata. The metadata typically includes at least basic technical metadata (size, content type, modification date, etc.), but can also include properties related to preservation, digitization process, provenance, etc. Files MUST be contained by exactly one Object.

@graph.name: conformsTo
@graph.rdfs:comment: An established standard to which the described resource conforms.
@graph.rdfs:label: conformsTo

@graph.name: Standard
@graph.rdfs:comment: A reference point against which other things can be evaluated or compared.
@graph.rdfs:label: Standard

@graph.name: Geometry
@graph.rdfs:label: Geometry
@graph.rdfs:comment: A geo spatial geometry

@graph.name: Place
@graph.rdfs:comment: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.
@graph.rdfs:label: Place

@graph.name: asWKT
@graph.rdfs:comment: The WKT serialization of a Geometry
@graph.rdfs:label: asWKT

@graph.name: Text
@graph.rdfs:comment: Data Type: Text
@graph.rdfs:label: Text

@graph.name: DataType
@graph.rdfs:comment: The basic data types such as Integers, Strings, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: DataType
